The Revolution of 1880 was the last military conflict of the Argentine Civil Wars. The conflict was between the government of the Province of Buenos Aires and the National government chaired by Nicolás Avellaneda. The event took place in June 1880, ending June 23 after the Battle of Los Corrales.
